ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, and as in the case of AC, the contribution from STR is minimal dispite it s raising ATK, just as the contribution of AGI is minimal dispite it s
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, Oct 11/00, Jeffrey Sue <jsue@...> wrote:
> i actually have a few questions about this stuff.
> +1 str == +1 atk right?
>
> now, is atk like ac in that it is made of up 2 numbers, like chance to hit, and damage
> done, sorta like damage avoidance and damage absorption? if so, then real damage
> applied would also have to increase.

Yes, and as in the case of AC, the contribution from STR is minimal
dispite it's raising ATK, just as the contribution of AGI is minimal
dispite it's raising of AC.

>
> anyone got a good link to the analysis done on this?
>

The best work I've seen was posted on the Paladin's of Norrath board
months ago. Not sure if it's still there but you could ask if someone
has it archived.

http://server5.ezboard.com/bpaladinsofnorrath.html

--
